channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OAK-3265] Test failures: NodeLocalNameTest, NodeNameTest
item.description:
Trunk's it fail for me:

testStringLiteralInvalidName(org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeLocalNameTest)  Time elapsed: 0.007 sec  <<< ERROR!

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This failed reliably for me three times in a row.

chetanm, thomasm, any idea what could have caused this regression?
I think this is caused by OAK-2634, but from what I can see, in some cases the tests are actually at fault.
Added the failing tests to the known issues list: http://svn.apache.org/r1697363

These failures are now also on 1.2 and 1.0. Changes for OAK-2634 were merged to those branches.

I will merge the update of the known issues list.
Merged to 1.2: http://svn.apache.org/r1700713 and 1.0: http://svn.apache.org/r1700714
thomasm, can you have a look at this? I think the tests fail because of OAK-2634.

NodeNameTest#testPathLiteral: I think I can fix this in Oak (running tests now).

NodeLocalNameTest (testStringLiteralInvalidName and testURILiteral): They expect the query to work, but return no rows, even thought the path is invalid. However, the same tests in NodeNameTest expect the query to fail, because of the invalid path. So I think this is a problem with the test.

As for NodeLocalNameTest#testPathLiteral, I can make it work, but this will break Node*Local*NameTest#testPathLiteral which uses a different assertion... So that one I would have to add to the ignore list as well. In theory, I think we should change the tests, but that would be more work as this would require us to change Jackrabbit 2.x. It doesn't seem to be worth the effort.

Proposed patch:

### Eclipse Workspace Patch 1.0
#P oak-core
Index: src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/oak/query/ast/NodeNameImpl.java
===================================================================
--- src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/oak/query/ast/NodeNameImpl.java	(revision 1700719)
+++ src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/oak/query/ast/NodeNameImpl.java	(working copy)
@@ -129,8 +129,13 @@
         name = ISO9075.decode(name);
         // normalize paths (./name > name)
         name = PropertyValues.getOakPath(name, query.getNamePathMapper());
-
-        if (name.startsWith("[") && !name.endsWith("]")) {
+        if (PathUtils.isAbsolute(name)) {
+            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Not a valid JCR name: "
+                    + name + " (absolute paths are not names)");
+        } else if (PathUtils.getDepth(name) > 1) {
+            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Not a valid JCR name: "
+                    + name + " (relative path with depth > 1 are not names)");
+        } else if (name.startsWith("[") && !name.endsWith("]")) {
             return null;
         } else if (!JcrNameParser.validate(name)) {
             return null;
#P oak-jcr
Index: pom.xml
===================================================================
--- pom.xml	(revision 1700719)
+++ pom.xml	(working copy)
@@ -106,8 +106,8 @@
       org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.SQLJoinTest#testJoinFilterPrimaryType                     <!-- OAK-474 -->
       org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.SQLJoinTest#testJoinSNS                                   <!-- OAK-474 -->
       org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeLocalNameTest#testStringLiteralInvalidName        <!-- OAK-3265 -->
+      org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeLocalNameTest#testPathLiteral                     <!-- OAK-3265 -->
       org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeLocalNameTest#testURILiteral                      <!-- OAK-3265 -->
-      org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeNameTest#testPathLiteral                          <!-- OAK-3265 -->
 
       org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.ExcerptTest#testMoreTextDotsAtEnd                             <!-- OAK-318 -->
       org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.ExcerptTest#testMoreTextDotsAtStart                           <!-- OAK-318 -->

In theory, I think we should change the tests, but that would be more work as this would require us to change Jackrabbit 2.x.

Alternatively we could indeed change the test and add the failing test in Jackrabbit 2.x on its known issues list.

> Alternatively we could indeed change the test and add the failing test in Jackrabbit 2.x on its known issues list.

Your are right, I didn't think about this option. I will try to do that.

But first, I'm trying to make the tests work.
http://svn.apache.org/r1700760
http://svn.apache.org/r1700767 (1.0 and 1.2 branch)

http://svn.apache.org/r1702201 (jackrabbit-jcr-tests and jackrabbit-core) fixed the test cases, and marked as "known issue" in jackrabbit-core

Will now wait for the next Jackrabbit release, so that the tests can be removed from the "known issue" list in oak-jcr, as follows:

Index: pom.xml
===================================================================
--- pom.xml	(revision 1701913)
+++ pom.xml	(working copy)
@@ -105,9 +105,6 @@
       org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.SQLJoinTest#testJoinNtBase                                <!-- OAK-474 -->
       org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.SQLJoinTest#testJoinFilterPrimaryType                     <!-- OAK-474 -->
       org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.SQLJoinTest#testJoinSNS                                   <!-- OAK-474 -->
-      org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeLocalNameTest#testStringLiteralInvalidName        <!-- OAK-3265 -->
-      org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeLocalNameTest#testPathLiteral                     <!-- OAK-3265 -->
-      org.apache.jackrabbit.test.api.query.qom.NodeLocalNameTest#testURILiteral                      <!-- OAK-3265 -->
 
       org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.ExcerptTest#testMoreTextDotsAtEnd                             <!-- OAK-318 -->
       org.apache.jackrabbit.core.query.ExcerptTest#testMoreTextDotsAtStart                           <!-- OAK-318 -->
http://svn.apache.org/r1710139 (fix test cases)
Wow, this really would have needed a JCR ticket!
